Previous Next

netsquid.qubits.opmath

netsquid.qubits.operators.sparse_padding_threshold

int - number of qubits at (and above) which to pad operators as sparse rather than dense matrices.

Mathematical tools for using and manipulating quantum operators.

netsquid.qubits.opmath.operate_dm(ndarray rho, operator, list qubit_indices, rho_out=None) → ndarray

Apply an operator to a density matrix.

Returns the result of \(O \, \rho\, O^\dagger\) for a given operator \(O\) and density matrix \(\rho\).

Parameters:

  • rho (ndarray) – Density matrix.

  • operator (Operator) – Operator to conjugate density matrix with.

  • qubit_indices (list of int) – Indices of qubit(s) in density matrix to apply operator to.

  • rho_out (numpy.array or None, optional) – Array to write resulting density matrix into. If None, a new output array is created. Can be the same array as rho parameter, in which case this input array is overridden.

Returns:

The conjugated density matrix.

Return type:

array

netsquid.qubits.opmath.operate_ket(ndarray ket, operator, list qubit_indices, ket_out=None) → ndarray

Apply an operator to a ket vector.

Returns the result of \(O\, \vert\psi\rangle\) for given operator \(O\) and ket \(\vert\psi\rangle\).

Parameters:

  • ket (array) – Ket vector.

  • operator (Operator) – Operator to conjugate density matrix with.

  • qubit_indices (list of int) – Indices of qubit(s) in ket vector to apply operator to.

  • ket_out (array or None, optional) – Array to write resulting ket vector into. If None, a new output array is created. Should not be the same array as ket parameter.

Returns:

The output ket vector.

Return type:

array

Raises:

ValueError – If ket_out is the same as ket.

netsquid.qubits.opmath.multi_operate_dm(ndarray rho, list operators, list qubit_indices, weights=None) → ndarray

Apply a (weighted) list of quantum operators to a density matrix.

Parameters:

  • rho (array) – Density matrix.

  • operators (list of Operator) – Operators acting on qubits.

  • qubit_indices (list of int) – Indices of qubit(s) in density matrix to apply operator to.

  • weights (tuple of float or None, optional) – Weights for each operator. The default (None) is for each operator to have a weight of 1.

Returns:

The resulting density matrix.

Return type:

array

netsquid.qubits.opmath.operate_sparse_dm(rho, operator, list qubit_indices, rho_out=None)

Apply an operator to a sparse density matrix.

Returns the result of \(O \rho O^\dagger\) for a given operator \(O\) and density matrix \(\rho\).

Parameters:

  • rho (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – Sparse density matrix.

  • operator (Operator) – Operator to conjugate density matrix with.

  • qubit_indices (list of int) – Indices of qubit(s) in density matrix to apply operator to.

  • rho_out (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix or None, optional) – sparse matrix to write resulting sparse density matrix into. If None, a new output sparse matrix is created. Can be the same sparse matrix as rho parameter, in which case this input sparse matrix is overridden.

Returns:

The conjugated sparse density matrix.

Return type:

scipy.sparse.csr_matrix

netsquid.qubits.opmath.multi_operate_sparse_dm(rho, list operators, list qubit_indices, weights=None)

Apply a (weighted) list of quantum operators to a sparse density matrix.

Parameters:

  • rho (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix) – Input sparse density matrix.

  • operators (list of Operator) – Operators acting on qubits.

  • qubit_indices (list of int) – Indices of qubit(s) in density matrix to apply operator to.

  • weights (tuple of float or None, optional) – Weights for each operator. The default (None) is for each operator to have a weight of 1.

Returns:

Resulting sparse density matrix

Return type:

scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
